item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 7, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Europe's most wanted man plotted my murder – and that of my colleague (41 points | 3 comments)
2. Great software design looks underwhelming (39 points | 3 comments)
3. Introducing command And commandfor In HTML (140 points | 68 comments)
4. Anthropic raises $3.5B at $61.5B valuation (173 points | 110 comments)
5. Microsoft is plotting a future without OpenAI (127 points | 80 comments)
6. Vtm: Text-Based Desktop Environment (106 points | 22 comments)
7. Optimistic Locking in B-Trees (52 points | 11 comments)
8. Strobelight: A profiling service built on open source technology (115 points | 41 comments)
9. Doge Is Putting Major Government Efficiency Projects at Risk (62 points | 17 comments)
10. The Take It Down Act isn't a law, it's a weapon (36 points | 18 comments)
11. The features of Python's help() function (16 points | 8 comments)
12. Betting on the Pope was the original prediction market (94 points | 47 comments)
13. Kraftful (YC S19) is hiring a founding eng to support our hockey-stick growth ( | hide)
14. Show HN: IEMidi –  Cross-platform MIDI map editor for arbitrary controllers (24 points | 2 comments)
15. Ladder: Self-improving LLMs through recursive problem decomposition (282 points | 90 comments)
16. No one asked for this: Google is testing round keys in Gboard (12 points | 5 comments)
17. Moscow-based global news network has infected Western AI tools (51 points | 19 comments)
18. WB offers replacements, but no refunds, for DVDs rotting prematurely (30 points | 25 comments)
19. Matters Computational (2010) [pdf] (133 points | 13 comments)
20. Show HN: A big tech dev experience for an open source CMS (25 points | 21 comments)
21. Differentiable Logic Cellular Automata (393 points | 73 comments)
22. Laser-based device can scan almost any sample of gas and tell you what's in it (79 points | 52 comments)
23. Ask HN: Do your eyes bug you even though your prescription is "correct"? (44 points | 69 comments)
24. Broadcom has won. 70 percent of large VMware customers bought its biggest bundle (13 points | 1 comment)
25. Kitchen foil and Algerian markets: When your phone is stolen in London (12 points | discuss)
26. Discovery of fresco portraying Dionysian mysteries at Pompeii (140 points | 76 comments)
27. Reading Martha Nussbaum's philosophy is pure pleasure (79 points | 90 comments)
28. Why Quantum Engineering Is Emerging as a Distinct Industrial Sector (32 points | 27 comments)
29. Mistral OCR (1638 points | 402 comments)
30. Performance optimization, and how to do it wrong (50 points | 12 comments)
